name: Beef Quinoa Meatballs
description: Lean beef meatballs made with quinoa instead of breadcrumbs. High in protein with complete amino acids.

instructions.instruction: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine ground beef, cooked quinoa, egg, onion, garlic, parsley, and spices.
instructions.tip: Mix gently to avoid tough meatballs.

instructions.instruction: Mix with your hands until just combined. Don't overwork.
Arrange meatballs on the baking sheet. Brush with olive oil.
Heat crushed tomatoes in a large pan.
Add baked meatballs to the sauce. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.

tips: Quinoa adds complete protein and fiber.
Baking instead of frying reduces fat.
Freezer-friendly - freeze for up to 3 months.
Great for meal prep and batch cooking.
storageInfo: Refrigerate for up to 4 days, or freeze for up to 3 months.
servingSuggestion: Serve over zucchini noodles, whole wheat pasta, or with a salad.
variations: Turkey or chicken can be used instead of beef.
Add feta cheese for a Greek twist.
